Text File : 1
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Use the monthly Calendar to make\na note of important dates.\cTouch any date to change its color.\nTouch it again to turn it back.\c

The Pokmon List indicates the\nstatuses of your team's Pokmon.\cTouch them to hear their cries.\nTheir HP bar is also displayed.\c
The Friendship Checker indicates how\nfriendly your Pokmon are to you.\cTouch the screen. The Pokmon that\nlike you will come closer.\c
The Day-Care Checker shows the\nPokmon you have in the Day Care.\cCheck and see how your Pokmon are\ndoing with the Day-Care Couple.\c
The Matchup Checker tests the\nattraction between Pokmon.\cThe greater the number of hearts,\nthe better likelihood of Eggs.\c
The Pokmon History keeps track of\nthe Pokmon you have obtained.\cIt shows the last twelve kinds of\nPokmon you obtained.\c
The Berry Searcher is a map that\nshows the locations of Berries.\cIt indicates the presence of Berries\nin areas you have already visited.\c
The Memo Pad is useful for jotting\ndown a note, or just doodling.\cThere's an eraser, too, just in case\nyou make a mistake.\c
The Dot Artist lets you draw pictures\nin a mosaic style.\cTouching the same dot makes its\ncolor turn darker.\c
The Color Changer changes the\nPoktch's display color.\cSlide the switch to select one\nof eight colors.\c
The Marking Map lets you mark\nintriguing locations.\cDrag marks to places on the map\nthat you want to remember.\c
The Roulette features a wheel\nthat can be written on.\cDraw numbers, items, or whatever on\nthe wheel and give it a spin!\c
The Coin Toss flips a coin that\ncomes up heads or tails.\cIf you can't choose between two\nchoices, a coin toss might be handy.\c
The Pedometer keeps a count of\nthe number of steps traveled.\cIt automatically counts steps.\nTouch the button to reset it.\c
The Dowsing Machine searches for\nhidden or obscured items.\cTouch the radar screen. If there is\nan item nearby, it will respond.\c
The Counter is used for counting\nthings one at a time.\cTouch the button and count whatever\nneeds counting.\c
The Trainer Counter tracks the\nperformance of the Pok Radar.\cIt shows how often you have met\nthe same kind of Pokmon in a row.\c
The Link Searcher searches for\nplayers on wireless communications.\cTouch the screen to get a list of\npeople using wireless communications.\c
The Move Tester checks how effective\nmoves are by type.\cSwitch the attacker and defender\ntypes to see what is effective.\c

The Exchange Service Corner is the\nbuilding that looks like a castle.\cThere, you may exchange the BP\n(Battle Points) you've earned for\ritems.\cFabulous prizes are offered, so\nplease do visit the Exchange Service\rCorner when you save up BP.\c

What would you like me to explain?
Every Trainer visiting the Battle Park\nis provided with a Point Card that\rconfirms their challenger status.\cThe Point Card stores BP (Battle\nPoints) that you earn from battling\rin the Battle Tower.\c
BP, short for Battle Points, are used\nonly in the Battle Park.\cYou will earn BP by hitting certain\nperformance targets battling at\rthe Battle Tower.\cThe BP can be traded for prizes at\nthe Exchange Service Corner.\c
Welcome to the Battle Park!\cI can give you a rundown of the\nbattle rules that are used at\rthe Battle Tower.\c
What would you like me to explain?
In the Battle Tower, you may enter\nPokmon in battles that are capped\rat Lv. 50.\cPokmon up to Lv. 50 may be entered\nwith a few exceptions.\cPokmon above Lv. 50 may also be\nentered, but their level will be\rcut to Lv. 50 in the Battle Tower.\cThe reduced level will be restored\nwhen you leave the Battle Tower.\cPlease keep in mind that your\nopponents will not use Pokmon below\rLv. 50.\c
Excluding Eggs and certain exotic\nPokmon, virtually every species of\rPokmon may enter the Battle Tower.\cPlease be aware that the number of\nPokmon you may enter will depend\ron the course you challenge.\cYou are also permitted to take only\none of each kind of Pokmon into\rthe Battle Tower.\c
Your Pokmon may not be holding the\nsame kind of item in the Battle\rTower.\cPlease be sure the Pokmon entering\nthe Battle Tower are all holding\rdifferent items.\c
Good luck!

Welcome to the Contest Hall!\cThis is the reception counter for\nlinked Super Contests.\cYou may join a group of friends to\nenter your Pokmon in the same\rSuper Contest over a link.\c
ENTER

Would you like to\nenter a link Contest?
Two to four players may compete\nover a link.\cFirst, choose the Contest you wish\nto enter.\cNext, make sure the other people in\nyour group choose the same Contest.\cThen, the players each choose a\nPokmon to enter the Contest, and\rthat's it for registration!\cAfter that, the Contest starts in\nthe usual way.\cWe hope you'll try it out.\c
A Pokmon Super Contest involves\nfour Trainers.\cEach one enters a Pokmon to\ncompete against the others.\cJudging is conducted in three\ncategories: Visual, Dance, and\rActing.\cThe Pokmon scoring the highest in\nthe three categories is the winner.\cIf this is your first time, it is\nrecommended you try some practice\rsessions before entering a Contest.\cThe registration counter for practice\nsessions is at the far right.\c
In the Visual Competition, Pokmon\nare rated on their appearance.\cScoring is based on votes cast by\nthe audience.\cFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\c
In the Dance Competition, the Pokmon\nwill get to show off their footwork.\cTry to put on coordinated dance\nperformances with everyone!\cFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\c
In the Acting Competition, the\nPokmon will perform their moves in\rfront of Judges.\cTry to get your Pokmon to put on\nperformances that stand out from the\rrest of the pack!\cFor details, please inquire at the\npractice counter on the right.\c
There are five Contests in all:\nCool, Beauty, Cute, Smart, and Tough.\cBe sure to choose the Contest that\nbest suits the Pokmon you want to\renter with.\c
There are four different ranks to\nthe Pokmon Super Contests.\cThe four ranks are Normal, Great,\nUltra, and Master.\cThe Normal Rank is open for entry\nby any Pokmon.\cA Pokmon winning a Normal Rank\nContest may move up to the Great\rRank in the same category.\cLikewise, win a Great Contest and\nbecome eligible for the Ultra Rank.\cAn Ultra Rank winner may move up to\nthe Master Rank in the same way.\cA Master Rank winner may enter\nMaster Rank Contests as often as\rthe Trainer wishes.\c

Please choose\na Pokmon.\c

We look forward to your next visit!
A Contest involves judging in three\ncategories: Visual, Dance, and\rActing.\cHere you may practice each of these\ncategories before you actually enter\ra real Contest.\cThere's just one thing. Your Pokmon\nmust know at least two moves.\cOtherwise, it will not qualify for our\nSuper Contests.\c
OVERALL FLOW
CONDITION POINTS
DRESS-UP POINTS
    
CANCEL
Judging here is based on the visual\nappeal of Pokmon.\cScoring is based on voting by the\naudience.\cThe more popular the Pokmon, the\nhigher its score!\cThe Pokmon are scored in two\ncategories: Condition Points and\rDress-up Points.\c
Condition Points are scored on\nthe Pokmon's condition in one of\rfive categories.\cThe five conditions are: Cool, Beauty,\nCute, Smart, and Tough.\cThese conditions can be enhanced by\nfeeding Poffins to your Pokmon.\cIf the audience likes what they see,\n[VAR FF00(0001)][VAR FF00(0000)] marks will appear.\cObviously, the more [VAR FF00(0001)][VAR FF00(0000)] marks there\nare, the more popular the Pokmon.\c
Dress-up Points are awarded for\nfashionably dressing up your Pokmon\rwith Accessories.\cBefore you begin, you will be given\na fashion theme.\cYour dressed-up Pokmon will be\nscored on how well it matches the\rassigned theme.\cThe audience's approval will appear\nas pink [VAR FF00(0001)][VAR FF00(0000)] marks.\cBe sure to position the Accessories\nproperly and attach them firmly.\rThey won't stay on otherwise.\cThere is a time limit of 60 seconds.\cGet your Pokmon dressed up within\nthat time.\c
    
We look forward to your next visit!
OVERALL FLOW
BACKUP DANCER
MAIN DANCER
PANEL
CANCEL
In a Dance Competition, the four\ncontestants take on different parts.\cOne becomes the main dancer, and the\nremaining three are backup dancers.\cThe main dancer scores points by\nperforming inspired dance steps\rthat the others can't copy.\cThe backup dancers earn high scores\nby duplicating the dance steps\rlaid down by the main dancer.\c
Your Pokmon will first appear as\na backup dancer.\cMake it dance using the same timing\nas the main dancer.\cUse the castanets to show your\nPokmon which direction the main\rdancer turned.\c
The main dancer rotates with a\nbackup dancer so everyone gets\ra turn.\cWhen your Pokmon is the main dancer,\nshow it how to dance!\c
The melody will be shown playing on\nthe red and blue panels.\cThe panel colors show who should be\ndancing.\cThe main dancer can dance while the\nmelody is in the blue panels.\cBackup dancers must dance only\nduring the red panels.\cThe dancers must perform the\nrequired number of dance steps\rduring their time slots.\c
We look forward to your next visit!
OVERALL FLOW
CONTEST MOVES
JUDGES
VOLTAGE
CANCEL
In the Acting Competition, four\nPokmon will perform their moves for\rour panel of Judges.\cThe more a Pokmon stands out, the\nhigher it scores.\cEach Pokmon will get the chance to\nperform four times.\c
Every move has one or more [VAR FF00(0001)][VAR FF00(0000)] marks\nthat indicate the acting score.\cThe more [VAR FF00(0001)][VAR FF00(0000)] marks obtained, the\nhigher the Pokmon scores.\cHowever, Pokmon are not permitted\nto perform the same move two turns\rin a row.\c
There are three Judges in all.\cYou get to choose which one you\nwant to judge your Pokmon.\cTry not to have your Pokmon scored\nby the same Judge as other Pokmon\rso it can stand out more.\cIf your Pokmon leaves a strong\nimpression, it will be rated highly,\rearning it more [VAR FF00(0001)][VAR FF00(0000)] marks.\c
Voltage shows the excitement level\nof the Judges.\cIn a Cool Contest, if a Pokmon uses\na Cool move, Voltage goes up.\cHowever, if a Cute or Smart move is\nperformed, the Voltage goes down.\cIf the Voltage reaches 5 points, the\nPokmon earns bonus points.\cIf the Special Judge in the center\nwas chosen, 8 bonus points are\rawarded when the Voltage peaks.\cFor the other Judges, 5 bonus points\nare awarded.\c
We look forward to your next visit!

There are four Battle Modes.\cSingle Battle is for two Trainers\nwith one or more Pokmon each.\cEach Trainer can have one Pokmon\nin battle at a time.\cDouble Battle is for two Trainers\nwith two or more Pokmon each.\cEach Trainer will send out two\nPokmon to battle at a time.\cMix Battle is for two Trainers\nwith three Pokmon each.\cEach Trainer chooses one of the\nopponent's Pokmon, mixes them\cwith their own party, and then\nbattles the other Trainer.\cMulti Battle is for four Trainers\nwith one or more Pokmon each.\cEach Trainer can have one Pokmon\nin battle at a time.\c

Seven Stars Restaurant\nMore Flavor Than You Can Wish For

Text File : 355

At our restaurant, you can enjoy\nmore than just exquisite dining.\cYou may also partake in battles.\nBon appetit!
I am so sorry.\nWe are now closed.\rPlease do visit while we are open.\c
Before we make our toast, I'd hoped\nfor a battle...\cHowever, you seem to be short\na Pokmon for that.
If you want to have a battle with us,\nyou'll need to bring more Pokmon.
With someone as beautiful as you for\nmy model, I am sure to paint\ra masterpiece!\c
What is it?\nDo you wish for a battle?\c
                                               
Though we lost our battle...\nA toast to your beauty, that no\rpainting could ever hope to capture!
He said he'd treat me to a dinner\nhere if I agreed to model for him.\cSo, I came along, but I haven't\nmade up my mind yet.\c
When I can't decide, I battle\nto make the decision!\c
                                                           
I've decided to model for him.\nThat's given me an appetite!
There is no price too high for the\nsake of my art...\cThat said, my oh my, these meals\nlook awfully pricey...\c
What is it?\nAre you feeling hungry, too?\cOh, I see, that's not it!\nYou wanted a battle!\c
                                           
My hors d'oeuvres have gone cold...
I have to slow down on eating these\ndelicious hors d'oeuvres.\cI don't want to be all bloated by\nthe time the main dish comes.\c
I'd like a light battle to work up\nmy appetite.\cWould you care to join us?\c
                                                                  
The hors d'oeuvres haven't grown\ncold...\cThese are supposed to be served\nchilled!
The worth of a meal isn't determined\nmerely by its flavor.\cPresentation, that is, color and\nplacement, is vital.\cIn other words, a fine meal can be\nlikened to the finest work of art...\c
And in Pokmon battles, I also hope\nto see beauty.\cYou do agree with me, yes?\c
                                                                                                 
The meals prepared here are not\nmerely tasty, they are also healthy.\cDiners need not worry about ruining\ntheir figures eating here.
Today's main dish is scrumptiously\ndelicious!\cIf I can keep eating this food,\nI'll model anytime I can!\c
I feel guilty just eating all\nthis delicious food like this.\cI'll join in the battle, too!\c
                                                              
The models of great paintings were\noften rather plump.\cThat means I can keep eating without\nobsessing over my figure!
If you want to challenge us, bring\nsome more Pokmon.
If you want to battle us, you have\nto have at least two Pokmon!
Actually, my father happens to be\nthe chef here.\c
What is it? A battle?\nBahaha... You think you can beat me?\c
                           
We've lost, but let's make a toast\nto our future together anyway!
Oh, my!\nYour father is the chef here?\cHow wonderful!\c
I haven't told him, but my father\nowns the hotel and restaurant...\cOh, but that's beside the point.\nWould you care for a battle?\c
                                           
Let's make a toast to the prosperity\nof the restaurant!
I have to hand it to my father--\nthese hors d'oeuvres are delicious!\c
...Are you maybe asking me for\na battle?\cWell, certainly!\nI never back down from a challenge!\c
                            
Finally. Now we can go about enjoying\nour meal without disruption.
Yes! This meal is good enough to\nserve at the hotel.\c
Please don't tell my date that my\nfather owns the restaurant.\cI'll have a battle with you if you\nkeep your mouth shut.
                            
My date did his best, but you were\nbetter than the both of us.
Fufufu, my date's really enjoying\nmy dad's cooking.\cShe has a dreamy expression after\nevery bite!\c
I'm feeling great!\nSure, I'll have a battle with you.\cThat's why you approached us, right?\c
                                 
My prowess as a Trainer isn't up to\nsnuff...\cIt's not like my father's scrumptious\ncooking...
This succulent flavor!\nIt reminds me of a world trip I took.\cMy father and I traveled everywhere\ndining at only the best restaurants.\c
Eating this fabulous meal has\nreally lifted my spirits.\cJoin us for a battle?\c
                                                        
Your father's cooking has a very\nmagical quality to it.\cIt seems to perk people up with\nenergy.
If your intention is to test your\nskill on us, I daresay you ought to\rbring at least another Pokmon.
Oh, you're offering to do battle\nwith us? How nice of you.\cUnfortunately, you simply cannot\nbattle us both with just one Pokmon.
Let me propose a toast to many\nmore happy years together.\c

Throw the Berry into the pot and\nget stirring!\cWatch for an arrow to show you which\ndirection to stir.\cBe quick! If you stir too slowly,\nyou'll burn the batter.\cBut not too quick! If you stir too fast,\nthe batter will overflow.\cIf you do well, you'll cook up a\ndelicious Poffin!\cYou may cook alone or in a group\nof up to four people.\cWith more cooks stirring, everyone will\nget more Poffins!
Please visit again whenever you get\nthe urge to cook!

The Pokmon makes it rain\nif it appears in battle.
The Pokmon's Speed stat\nis gradually boosted.
The Pokmon is protected\nagainst critical hits.
The Pokmon is protected\nagainst 1-hit KO attacks.
Prevents combatants from\nself destructing.
The Pokmon is protected\nfrom paralysis.

Contact with the Pokmon\nmay cause paralysis.
Restores HP if hit by an\nElectric-type move.

Prevents the Pokmon\nfrom becoming infatuated.
Eliminates the effects of\nweather.

Prevents the Pokmon\nfrom falling asleep.
Changes the Pokmon's\ntype to the foe's move.

Negates moves that\nforce switching out.

Fly to where?
GUIDE MAP
A small path through a lush, green,\nwooded area. The densely grown trees\ngive off a thick aroma.
A winding path that twists through\ngrassy fields. Young Trainers like to\ntest their battle skills here.
Despite being so close to a big town,\nthis path retains its relaxed, natural\natmosphere.
Once one gets through the tunnel,\nthe city of Oreburgh is just a stone's\nthrow away.
A charmingly natural path that wanders\npast many ponds and groves of trees.
The Ravaged Path was hewn through\na rocky outcropping. It is a shortcut\nthat leads straight to Floaroma Town.
A wide, wooden walkway spans a large\npond. Fishermen idle their time away\ndangling lines from the walkway.
A quietly flowing stream and hilly\nterrain with one-way ledges make this\na fun area for adventure.
Near the entrance of Eterna Forest\nis a cabin whose keepers offer rest\nto weary travelers that stop by.
Smoothly paved in asphalt, the Cycling\nRoad is heavenly for bicycle lovers.
Below the Cycling Road, one can see\nthe entrance to Wayward Cave.
Located at the foot of Mt. Coronet,\nthis road is carved into the rugged,\nrocky terrain.
A lush field of grass spreads from\nMt. Coronet's sheer rock face,\ncreating a vista of contrasts.
The Berry Master, an old man who loves\nnature, Pokmon, and Berries, makes\nhis home here.
The streams forded by this path wind\npast copses and grassy patches in\na serene and soothing manner.
The Lost Tower is where Pokmon are\nlaid to rest when their lives come\nto an end.
A path made by clearing an overgrown\ncanyon between mountains. It is always\nshrouded by a dense fog.
Grandma Wilma's house stands alone in an\nisolated spot deep among mountains.
This narrow route is lined with deep,\ntall grass that tickles the noses of\npeople straying off the path.
The Cafe Cabin stands in a wood.\nThe house special is freshly milked\nMoomoo Milk.
A mountain path that tunnels through\nMt. Coronet, one of the tallest\nmountains in Sinnoh.
A tall, sturdy wall surrounds an\nexpansive estate that takes up nearly\nhalf of the road space.
Beyond the wall, one can see the\nstately Pokmon Mansion and the\nowner's prized garden behind it.\n
This path weaves among deep puddles\nmade by the unending rainfall. It is\nwet and miserable for Trainers.
There is a house here whose residents\noffer to trade TMs for Red, Blue,\nYellow, or Green Shards.
Offshore boulders form a jetty that\nbecalms waves reaching the beach.\nA resort hotel overlooks the water.
In a small house on the beach lives\na single man who refers to himself as\nDr. Footstep.
The road joining Veilstone City and a\nlake is described as either wildly\nnatural or simply a mess.
There is a cave hewn into the sheer\nrock wall at the roadside. The hole\nwas made by a Ruin Maniac.
This area is always inundated by heavy\nrainfall. Only hardy Trainers that can\ntake the rain gather here.
This mountainous road leads from Mt.\nCoronet. Its constant snowfall and\ndeep snowdrifts impede travelers.
Snow blows down from Mt. Coronet and\ngrows into a harsh, ceaseless blizzard.\nBe prepared for the worst.
Despite its shortness, this road is\nrevered by fishing enthusiasts as a\ngreat, yet little known, fishing spot.
A beautiful white-sand beach only five\nseconds on foot from Sandgem Town.\nA pleasant breeze blows from the sea.
The sea here is perfect for swimming,\nwith gentle winds and tides. There are\nsandbars for resting, too.
A straight path hemmed by green grass\nand sparse stands of trees.
At the end of the path stands the\ngateway to Pal Park.
A sandy beach extends from the road.\nThe beach is busy with avid Fishermen\nhappily casting at the water's edge.
A man who loves fishing lives near\nhere. There is also a man who will\ncompare sizes of caught fish.
A marine route that requires travelers\nto navigate around jutting rocks and\nsandbars.
With grass fields, rocky outcroppings,\nthe sea, and sandbars, this area is\nlike a miniature of the Sinnoh region.
The path makes its way up and down\namong rocky outcroppings. It is\nphysically challenging.
A path that winds precariously along\nsheer cliffs that go right to the edge\nof the sea's pounding waves.
There is a small island in the bay.\nAn odd man who speaks foreign\nlanguages lives there.
A rugged and steep mountain path\nwhere vision is limited by steadily\nfalling volcanic ash.
This rough path is harshly raked by\na horizontally blowing sandstorm\ndriven by strong winds off the sea.
A seaside path that makes its way\nthrough wildly growing trees and\nplants.

A straight path bounded by the sea on\nboth sides. It leads to the Flower\nParadise.
A small town with the fresh scent\nof new leaves in the air. It feels\nlike a place where adventures start.
Your own home and your best friend's\nhouse are located here.

Prof. Rowan's lab is the town's\nlandmark. He conducts his\nstudies on Pokmon here.

In the center of town is the flower\nshop called Pick a Peck of Colors.
The temperate climate makes this town\na relaxed and casual place for people\nand Pokmon to live in.
There is a Pokmon Day Care and\na Pokmon Center here.
Beyond a path hemmed by stands of\ntrees, one can find the entrance\nto the Solaceon Ruins.
A tiny town that preserves the history\nof Sinnoh and the old ways of life.
In the center of the town is a small\nshrine that dates to ancient times.
A city where hot-blooded Trainers\ngather to work out and hone their\nbattling skills.
A city that attracts Trainers who\nknow there are other ways of enjoying\nPokmon than battling.
The most modernized city in the Sinnoh\nregion. It is bustling with people on\nthe go.
The Poktch Company, the developer\nand manufacturer of the Poktch, is\nlocated here.
Jubilife TV, Sinnoh's TV network, is\nlocated here. It is an entertaining\nplace to visit.
The Global Trade Station--GTS for\nshort--is located here.
Located here is the Trainers' School.\nDrop in to study up on the basics of\nPokmon.
A port city that is bisected by a\ncanal. It has a distinctly exotic air\nof foreign culture.
Head to the library if you want a\nworkout for the mind. Head to the Gym\nif you just want to work out.
Large ships can always be seen\nmoored at the town's piers.
A vibrant and energetic mining town\nthat is blessed with a precious natural\nresource.
There is a Gym where mine workers\ntake breaks in between their\nexhausting work shifts.
There is a museum that specializes in\nexhibits related to the town's coal\nmine.
Huge deposits of coal still sleep\nunderneath the ground. The entrance\nto the Oreburgh Coal Mine is here.
An old city that shows fading and\nalmost-forgotten vestiges of ancient\nhistory.
The Cycle Shop is located here.\nThere is also a big building with\na slightly sinister atmosphere.
A statue of an ancient Pokmon is\nprominently and reverentially displayed.
A Gym is indispensable in any town that\nhas many people coming and going.\nThis city is no exception.
This friendly city started as a place\nwhere people and Pokmon gathered,\nthen grew into a center of commerce.
The entrance to Amity Square is here.\nThe square is a place where Trainers\ncan stroll peacefully with Pokmon.
If you care about the looks of your\nPokmon, head for the Contest Hall.\nFor toughness, go to the Gym.
There is a building here that is\nsymbolic of the city's status as a\nplace where different cultures meet.
A nice fountain with benches, as well\nas the Pokmon Fan Club, are among\nthe city's amenities.
This city was originally founded to\nprotect the Great Marsh. It has grown\nnaturally over the years.
The Gym is a good example of the\nabundant water resources available to\nthe city.
There is a lookout that affords views\nof the Great Marsh. The gates to\nthe Safari Zone are also here.
This city was made by carving out\nsteep, rocky mountains. Its isolation\nlimits its contact with other cities.
There are warehouses for storing a\nvariety of goods. There is also a\nmajor department store.
At the highest point in the city is\nTeam Galactic's headquarters.
The city puts effort into providing\nentertainment. Naturally, one can find\na Gym here.
Conveniently located right next door\nto the Game Corner is the Prize\nExchange.
A port city that was built around the\nbay portion of the cape. It is criss-\ncrossed by elevated walkways.
The Gym is located atop a rocky\noutcropping. Down on the beach is\na festive bazaar.
The Vista Lighthouse's bright beacon\nilluminates the Sinnoh region.
A winter wonderland of a city where\nstout trees and buildings are blanketed\nin thick snow.
The Gym is at the heart of the city.\nTo the north is the Snowpoint Temple.
Trainers seeking to become the best\narrive here after enduring a long and\ngrueling journey.
The Pokmon League reception counter\nis located here. Only those who have\nbeaten all the Gyms may enter.

A tiny port town where Trainers who\nlove battling more than eating gather.
Moored at the pier is the ferry to\nSnowpoint City.
The gateway to the Battle Park is\nlocated here.

Beneath the lake's surface is a cave\nwhere dimensions are distorted.

Winds blowing through the canyon feed\nthe wind turbines to generate clean\nelectricity.
A forest enveloped in chilly air.\nThick stands of trees turn the forest\ninto a natural maze.
Deep in the forest is the Old Chateau.\nIt is falling into disrepair after\nbeing abandoned by its owner.
The sprawling ironworks is located\nwith the forest at its back.

The Battle Tower--where the best of\nthe best Trainers gather to test\ntheir skill--is located here.

If the foe has\nalready taken some\ndamage in the same\nturn, this attack's\npower is doubled.
It prevents the foe\nfrom using its held\nitem. Its Trainer is\nalso prevented from\nusing items on it.
The user flings its\nheld item at the foe\nto attack. Its power\nand effects depend\non the item.

Text File : 615
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

For some time after its birth, it\ngrows by gaining nourishment from\nthe seed on its back.
When the bud on its back starts\nswelling, a sweet aroma wafts to\nindicate the flower's coming bloom.
After a rainy day, the flower on\nits back smells stronger. The\nscent attracts other Pokmon.
The fire on the tip of its tail is a\nmeasure of its life. If healthy,\nits tail burns intensely.
In the rocky mountains where\nCHARMELEON live, their fiery\ntails shine at night like stars.
It is said that CHARIZARD's fire\nburns hotter if it has\nexperienced harsh battles.
It shelters itself in its shell,\nthen strikes back with spouts of\nwater at every opportunity.
It is said to live 10,000 years.\nIts furry tail is popular as a\nsymbol of longevity.
The jets of water it spouts from\nthe rocket cannons on its shell\ncan punch through thick steel.
It releases a stench from its red\nantenna to repel enemies. It\ngrows by molting repeatedly.
A steel-hard shell protects its\ntender body. It quietly endures\nhardships while awaiting evolution.

It rests its forelegs on others to\ncommunicate with rhythmic electric\npulses from its claws.
When its eyes gleam gold, it can\nspot hiding prey--even those\ntaking shelter behind a wall.
It lives alongside clear ponds.\nIt scatters pollen that induces\nharsh sneezing and runny noses.
With the movements of a dancer,\nit strikes with whips that are\ndensely lined with poison thorns.
It was resurrected from an iron\nball-like fossil. It downs prey with\nits head butts.
